#summary Muscles of Human Neck

Related findings are structured by other research themes.

== Pharynx ==
(generated)

  * *[http://www.wisegeekhealth.com/what-is-a-pharyngeal-tonsil.htm Lung - pharyngeal tonsils]*; TYPE={gland}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial pharyngeal nerve]}; ACTION={enhance the capabilities of the lymphatic system against foreign agents that enter through nose}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stylopharyngeus_muscle Lung - stylopharyngeus muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial glossopharyngeal nerve, stylopharyngeal branch]}; ACTION={elevate the larynx, elevate the pharynx, swallowing}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salpingopharyngeus_muscle Nose - salpingopharyngeus muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial vagus nerve, pharyngeal plexus]}; ACTION={raise the nasopharynx}
  * *Pharyngeal constrictor*
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inferior_pharyngeal_constrictor_muscle Mouth - inferior pharyngeal constrictor muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial laryngeal nerve, external]}; ACTION={swallowing}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_pharyngeal_constrictor_muscle Mouth - middle pharyngeal constrictor muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial vagus nerve, pharyngeal plexus]}; ACTION={swallowing}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superior_pharyngeal_constrictor_muscle Mouth - superior pharyngeal constrictor muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial vagus nerve, pharyngeal plexus]}; ACTION={swallowing}

== Larynx ==
(generated)

  * *Cricoarytenoid muscle*
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lateral_cricoarytenoid_muscle Mouth - lateral cricoarytenoid muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={adduct and medially rotate the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments towards the midline and backwards and so closing off the rima glottidis}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Posterior_cricoarytenoid_muscle Mouth - posterior cricoarytenoid muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={abducts and laterally rotates the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments away from the midline and forward and so opening the rima glottidis}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aryepiglottic_muscle Mouth - aryepiglottic muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={close the inlet}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arytenoid_muscle Mouth - arytenoid muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial laryngeal nerve, external]}; ACTION={approximate the arytenoid cartilages (close rima glottidis)}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cricothyroid_muscle Mouth - cricothyroid muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial laryngeal nerve, external]}; ACTION={tension and elongation of the vocal folds (has minor adductory effect)}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levator_muscle_of_thyroid_gland Mouth - levator muscle of thyroid gland]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial laryngeal nerve, external]}; ACTION={elevates the thyroid gland}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oblique_arytenoid Mouth - oblique arytenoid muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={sphincter of the laryngeal inlet}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thyroarytenoid_muscle Mouth - thyroarytenoid muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={thickens the vocal folds and decreases length; also helps to adduct the vocal folds during speech}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thyroepiglottic_muscle Mouth - thyroepiglottic muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={closes the inlet to the larynx}

= TARGET.TEA.NECK =

== Cervical ==
(generated)

  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Platysma_muscle Face - platysma muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial facial nerve, cervical branch]}; ACTION={Draws the corners of the mouth inferiorly and widens it (as in expressions of sadness and fright). Also draws the skin of the neck superiorly when teeth are clenched}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sternocleidomastoid_muscle Neck - sternocleidomastoid muscle]*; TYPE={flexor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial accessory nerve, external]}; ACTION={Acting alone, tilts head to its own side and rotates it so the face is turned towards the opposite side. Acting together, flexes the neck, raises the sternum and assists in forced inspiration.}
  * *Splenius muscles*
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Splenius_capitis_muscle Neck - splenius capitis muscle]*; TYPE={extensor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to splenius capitis muscle]}; ACTION={prime mover for head extension; can also allow lateral flexion and rotation of the cervical spine}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Splenius_cervicis_muscle Neck - splenius cervicis muscle]*; TYPE={extensor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to splenius cervilis muscle]}; ACTION={bilaterally: extend the head and neck, unilaterally: lateral flexion to the same side, rotation to the same side}

== Suprahyoid ==
(generated)

  * *Digastric muscle*
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digastric_muscle Mouth - digastric muscle, facial]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial facial nerve, digastric branch]}; ACTION={opens the jaw when the masseter and the temporalis are relaxed}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digastric_muscle Mouth - digastric muscle, trigeminal]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial mylohyoid nerve]}; ACTION={opens the jaw when the masseter and the temporalis are relaxed}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geniohyoid_muscle Mouth - geniohyoid muscle]*; TYPE={flexor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to geniohyoid]}; ACTION={carry hyoid bone and the tongue upward during deglutition}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mylohyoid_muscle Mouth - mylohyoid muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial mylohyoid nerve]}; ACTION={raises oral cavity floor, elevates hyoid, depresses mandible}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stylohyoid_muscle Mouth - stylohyoid muscle]*; TYPE={cranial}; NERVES={[HumanNervesCranial facial nerve, stylohyoid branch]}; ACTION={elevate the hyoid during swallowing}

== Infrahyoid/Strap ==
(generated)

  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thyroid Mindcover - thyroid gland]*; TYPE={gland}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical middle cervical ganglion, thyroid branches]}; ACTION={release thyroid hormones into blood}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omohyoid_muscle Mouth - omohyoid muscle]*; TYPE={extensor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical ansa cervicalis, superior root]}; ACTION={Depresses the larynx and hyoid bone. Carries hyoid bone backward and to the side}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sternohyoid_muscle Mouth - sternohyoid muscle]*; TYPE={extensor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical ansa cervicalis, inferior root]}; ACTION={depress hyoid bone}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sternothyroid_muscle Mouth - sternothyroid muscle]*; TYPE={extensor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical ansa cervicalis, inferior root]}; ACTION={elevates larynx, may slightly depress hyoid bone}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thyrohyoid_muscle Mouth - thyrohyoid muscle]*; TYPE={extensor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical thyroid nerve]}; ACTION={depresses hyoid bone and elevates the larynx}

== Vertebrate ==
(generated)

  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longus_capitis_muscle Neck - longus capitis muscle]*; TYPE={flexor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to longus capitis and longus colli muscles]}; ACTION={flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longus_colli_muscle Neck - longus colli muscle]*; TYPE={flexor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to longus capitis and longus colli muscles]}; ACTION={flexes the neck and head}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rectus_capitis_anterior_muscle Neck - rectus capitis anterior muscle]*; TYPE={flexor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to atlanto-occipital joint muscles]}; ACTION={flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rectus_capitis_lateralis_muscle Neck - rectus capitis lateralis muscle]*; TYPE={flexor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to atlanto-occipital joint muscles]}; ACTION={sidebend at atlanto-occipital joint, takes care of flexing the neck}
  * *Scalene muscles*
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalenus_anterior Neck - scalenus anterior muscle]*; TYPE={flexor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to scalene and levator scapulae muscles]}; ACTION={C5, C6, elevates first rib, rotate the neck to the opposite side}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalenus_medius Neck - scalenus medius muscle]*; TYPE={flexor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to scalene and levator scapulae muscles]}; ACTION={C3, C4, C5, C6, C7, C8, elevate 1st rib, laterally flex (bend) the neck to the same side}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalenus_posterior Neck - scalenus posterior muscle]*; TYPE={flexor}; NERVES={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to scalene and levator scapulae muscles]}; ACTION={C6, C7, C8, elevate 2nd rib, tilt the neck to the same side}
